deck: A high-ranking executive with Godcorp, Woblina Strangelegs also puts her superhuman agility and flexibility to use as one of Godcorp's top enforcers.
description:
An executive with the powerful corporation Godcorp, Woblina Strangelegs served not only as the head of its Socio-Technology Department, but also as the corporation president Ned Packer's personal assistant, bodyguard, and enforcer. Her position frequently brought her into conflict with Destroyer Duck, sometimes as a behind-the-scenes manipulator and sometimes in direct physical combat.

Woblina Strangelegs was finally killed, along with several other Godcorp associates, when a nuclear bomb was detonated aboard their corporate jet.

Powers and Abilities

Woblina Strangelegs possessed superhuman agility and flexibility, capable of moving her limbs at any angle. She described herself as being not merely double-jointed, but "universal-jointed."

first_appeared_in_issue.name: It's Got the Whole World... In Its Hand!

issue_credits.name: It's Got the Whole World... In Its Hand!

name: Woblina Strangelegs

deck: A child whose pheromones make her extraordinarily loveable. Exploited and merchandised by Godcorp, who protect their trademark so strongly that "TM" is actually part of her name.
name: Vanilla Cupcake TM

deck: Older sister of Vanilla Cupcake (TM). She joined forces with Destroyer Duck against their mutual enemy Godcorp.
description:
From birth, Beryl Mudge secreted cherry-scented pheromones that rendered her irresistably lovable. Feeling smothered by the constant attention, she acted out in a rebellious manner, but even her acts of vandalism were immediately forgiven. When her younger sister Opal was similarly born with vanilla-scented pheromones, they were studied by scientists seeking to isolate the cause of their remarkable appeal. The corporation Godcorp realized that the sisters' pheromones could be exploited and marketed; however, Beryl refused to cooperate and attempted to take her sister away.

Godcorp, with the consent of Beryl's mother Jewel Mudge, had Beryl committed to a mental institution to keep her out of the way as they groomed Opal into the children's-toy character Vanilla Cupcake TM (protecting their trademark so fiercely that "TM" was actually part of the name). Beryl eventually escaped and began training herself in combat and weaponry to fight the forces of Godcorp. Assuming the name of Cherries Jubilee, she joined forces with Destroyer Duck, who likewise sought revenge on Godcorp, and together they rescued Opal.

Powers and Weapons

Cherries Jubilee secretes powerful pheromones that make her irresistably appealing; she is able to persuade most people to do whatever she asks. Her power can be overcome by the use of a special gas mask that filters out her scent. Her pheromones are ineffective on the mentally unbalanced (such as the single-minded Booster Cogburn clones).

She is a highly skilled hand-to-hand combatant, and has equipped herself with a variety of cherry-themed weapons: A supply of explosive "cherry bombs," a five-pound iron "jawbreaker" necklace which she can wield as a flail, and a protective cherry-shaped helmet.
name: Cherries Jubilee

deck: A series of genetically engineered clones created by Godcorp. When one Cogburn dies, its spine detaches itself and grows a new body.
name: Booster Cogburn

deck: Senjumaru Shutara is a member of the Royal Guard of the Gotei 13.
description:
Origin

Creation

Senjumaru Shutara (修多羅 千手丸, Shutara Senjumaru) is a character in the BLEACH series that was created by Tite Kubo, It first began serialization Shueisha's Weekly Shonen Jump in August 2001. She was first introduced during the the Thousand-Year Blood War Arc that began in Volume 55.

She first appeared in BLEACH Volume 58 CH. 516 "THE SQUAD ZERO".

Character Evolution

Major Story Arcs

Senjumaru first appears in the Thousand-Year Blood War Arc, where she and the other Royal Guard members are summoned to Soul Society in the aftermath of the Vandenreich invasion. After arriving in Soul Society via the Royal Guard's Tenchūren, Senjumaru retrieves Rukia Kuchiki, Byakuya Kuchiki, Renji Abarai, and Ichigo Kurosaki's broken Tensa Zangetsu by placing them in translucent orbs; she openly admits to Captain Mayuri Kurotsuchi, who had been keeping an eye on the Kuchiki siblings and Renji Abarai, that she picked the lock to his compound in order to retrieve them all, stating the lock was easier to pick than when she was in charge of the facility.

After returning to the Soul King Palace with the Royal Guard and Ichigo Kurosaki, Senjumaru tells Ichigo that while Sosuke Aizen was undoubtedly the "personification of evil," the Vandenreich pose an even greater threat than he.

Some time later, Senjumaru assists in the recuperation of Rukia and Renji by taking them to her palace in order to measure them for new robes. When Renji refuses to take off his fundoshi, Senjumaru casually threatens to cut off his genitals should he not comply, prompting Renji to reluctantly agree to be measured everywhere on his body. After the experience, both Renji and Rukia dread even thinking about returning to Senjumaru's palace.
name: Senshumaru Shutara

deck: Ichibei Hyōsube, aka Manako Oshō "Monk of Perception", is a member of the Royal Guard of the Gotie 13.
name: Oshō

description: Judith Meyers is the 17 year old sole female survivor of a zombie plague that turns only females into vicious, male killing zombies. She grew up in the Tenderloin district of San Francisco raised by junkie parents. When they died of an overdose, she and her brother were sent off to separate foster homes. When the plague hits, she goes on a mission to rescue her brother who is incarcerated in a juvenile detention facility.
name: Judith Meyers

description:
Height: 6’2”

Weight: 225 lbs.

Eyes: Brown

Hair: Brown

Occupation: High School Nutrition Teacher

Enemies: Gorilla Guy, Yo-Yo Man, the Tinkler

Base of Operations: Taylor Tuckey High School

Weapons: Cement banana, bananarang, nan-chucks

Powers/Abilities: Banana Man is an expert in machine and hand sewing

History

Andre Andre is a high school nutrition teacher in Taylor Tuckey, Michigan. He had become disillusioned at his job as students attention spans were becoming shorter. He sewed a costume of his own creation to become Banana Man. He then held a school assembly in the gymnasium where he preached the importance of potassium in the students’ diet. His speech was interrupted by a mysterious figure who was dressed in an ape outfit that had his own message about a bleak future where the Earth was overtaken by talking apes. This figure came to be known as Gorilla Guy.

Banana Man smacked Gorilla Guy with a banana which did not turn out to be an effective attack as Gorilla Guy responded with a punch that knocked him down. Banana Man then went and created a concrete banana and sewed a banana peel around it. Gorilla Guy thought this was simply a regular banana until Banana Man knocked him out with it. The students at the assembly had thought Banana Man was pretty strange, but after hearing what Gorilla Guy had to say they came to appreciate Banana Man. Gorilla Guy was able to slip away as Banana Man was basking in his glory.

Andre became obsessed with figuring out who Gorilla Guy was, but could not come up with a way to find him. He decided to attend a comic book convention where Linda Harrison, one of the stars of the original Planet of the Apes movie, was scheduled to appear. This turned out to work against Andre as the convention had lots of people dressed in gorilla costumes. Gorilla Guy did eventually reveal himself when he found out that Linda Harrison could talk. This enraged him because in the movie she was mute. Banana Man had created more weapons including nan-chucks and a bananarang, but he was topped by Gorilla Guy who had created a banana blade.

Banana Man was stuck paying for toys that were damaged in the battle. He did however find a raffle ticket that Gorilla Guy had dropped that was for his school raffle from which he deduced that Gorilla Guy must work at his school. While playing with his newly acquired convention toys, Andre was interrupted by Kelly, a fellow teacher, with whom he was supposed to meet to go over her lesson plans. Andre was very disappointed that because of his distractions with Gorilla Guy he had missed an opportunity to hang out with the hottest teacher in the school.

Andre then started looking around the school to find Gorilla Guy’s identity. After eliminating several teachers and the janitor, Andre was visited by a student, Alvin, who was offering to sell raffle tickets. Alvin informed Andre that he had been selling tickets in packs of five, so Andre offered to eliminate a detention he had given Alvin in exchange for Alvin rigging the raffle. Alvin would call off one of the tickets that was one number up from the ticket that Andre had found at the comic convention that was dropped by Gorilla Guy. During halftime of the school football game, Alvin called off the winning number where the winner would receive a George Foreman refrigerator.

The ticket belonged to Mr. Frank, the school science teacher. Banana man tackled Frank from behind, and accused him of being Gorilla Guy. Frank denied this, but Banana Man did not believe him until Gorilla Guy showed up behind him. Banana Man and Gorilla Guy had a brawl that encompassed the entire football field where Banana Man was finally victorious. Gorilla Guy was revealed to be Alvin who received another detention. Andre then started to notice a smell in his classroom where he discovered that someone had urinated.

Andre discussed this with the principal, Mr. John, who informed him that this had happened numerous times during the previous week. John decided to give Andre a chance to prove himself as Banana Man and assigned him the task of finding out the identity of the Tinkler. Andre was very proud of this, but he was made fun of by Mr. Frank who still resented being tackled. The two of them discovered the latest attack of the Tinkler in the teacher’s lounge where they found that the his attacks were not limited to the liquid method of human waste. Banana Man then created a cardboard cutout of himself that he wired with electricity to lure out the Tinkler.

This proved to be too tempting for the Tinkler as he was caught within minutes of it being set up. Andre was then reprimanded by John who did not approve of his methods. Luckily the student that was caught was not seriously injured, and he had a bad home life so his parents did not get involved. Andre was still discouraged that he was not making a difference in anyone’s life, and he tried making a poster to help better influence eating habits. This poster was defaced, and then the replacement poster was stolen. Frank continued to make fun of Andre to which Andre replied that he didn’t care if he only reached one student it would still be worth is effort. This did not stop Frank’s taunts, but Andre eventually realizes that his life was not that bad.

Unknown to Andre, it was revealed that there was a student that Banana Man’s influence had reached, and this student had stolen the poster to hang in his room at home. Mr. Frank was the next person to interrupt one of Banana Man’s assemblies. Frank was dressed in his own costume and called himself Yo-Yo Man. Banana Man chased him back to his office where Yo-Yo Man had set up a trap. Banana Man found himself strung upside down over a boiling vat of chocolate. He was able to escape with the help of Gorilla Guy.

Gorilla Guy had been suffering from a nutritional deficiency which he was able to overcome by eating more bananas. Together Banana Man and Gorilla Guy pummeled Yo-Yo Man. All three were reprimanded by the principal, Mr. John.

Banana Man should not be confused with Bananaman, an old British character.
name: Banana Man

description: Gorilla Guy believes that the Earth will be overtaken by talking apes. He intends to inform everyone of this impending doom and his plan to prevent it
name: Gorilla Guy

deck: Genoshan Magistrate
description:
Origin

Recruited as a Genoshan Magistrate.

Creation

Written by Chris Claremont and drawn by Rick Leonardi.

Major Story Arcs

Mollo is called out to flag down a commandeered Magistrate flyer. He and two other Magistrates are unable to pull the flyer over so Mollo jumps onto the flyer to force the pilots to the ground. He opens the hatch, however, to find that no one is in the cockpit. In fact, the craft has been rigged to blow if someone does exactly as Mollo does. The craft explodes and Mollo falls; fortunately he is caught by one of his fellow flyers.
name: Mollo

deck: Kūkaku Shiba is the current head of the proud Shiba Clan known for their fireworks skills in the Soul Society.
description:
Origin

Kūkaku Shiba is a member of the prestigious Shiba Clan of the Soul Society and the younger sister of Kaien Shiba. Much of her history is unknown. After the death of Kaien and his wife, Kūkaku became the de facto head of the Shiba Clan. Jushiro Ukitake, Kaien's commander, came to explain how Kaien had been infected by a Hollow and died at the hands of Rukia Kuchiki to stop his rampage. Despite knowing the circumstances, Kūkaku refused to forgive Rukia until she came to apologize, which she never did.

Creation

Kūkaku Shiba (志波 空鶴, Shiba Kūkaku) is a supporting character of the BLEACH series that was created by Tite Kubo, It first began serialization Shueisha's Weekly Shonen Jump in August 2001. She was first introduced during the Soul Society: The Sneak Entry story arc that began in Volume 9.

She first appeared in BLEACH Volume 9, CH. 78 "Fourteen Days for Conspiracy".

Character Evolution

Major Story Arcs

Soul Society: The Sneak Entry Arc

Yoruichi appeared at Kūkaku's home along with some young allies, one of which being a Soul Reaper named Ichigo Kurosaki. She wanted her help in breaking through the barrier of the Seiretei. Though she trusted Yoruichi, she didn't trust her friends. Kūkaku only agreed to help as long as they took her brother Ganju. Ichigo and Ganju fought, but Kūkaku put an end to that. After they were all trained to use the Reishūkaku, Kūkaku shot them into to the fortress of the Soul Society to rescue an ally of theirs.

Soul Society: The Rescue Arc

After several days, Kūkaku went to meet with Jidanbō Ikkanzaka, the Western Gate guard, so they could go join the fight. As they arrived, Sosuke Aizen's plot had been revealed. The other gate guards had allied with Aizen, and Kūkaku defeated one with Kido. Aizen soon escaped to Hueco Mundo with his allies.

Sometime later. Kūkaku was punishing Ganju of failing to help in the battle and running from fights. That's when Rukia Kuchiki came to finally apologize for killing Kaien and for taking so long. Kūkaku punches Rukia for taking too long, then reveals that she already knew the whole story. She had just been waiting for Rukia to come and apologize herself before she forgave her. When Ichigo and Orihime arrive, Kūkaku invites them all for dinner.

The Thousand-Year Blood War Arc

The Soul Society was nearly destroyed by the assault from the Vandenreich. With the arrival of the Royal Guard, they came to Kūkaku to return to the Soul King Palace with Ichigo, Renji, Rukia, and Byakuya.She then ordered Ganju to go back to training Ginjo Kugo, Giriko Kutsuzawa, and Shukuro Tsukishima for what would likely be the final battle.

Powers & Abilities

Kūkaku Shiba was raised and educated by Koganehiko and Shiroganehiko, but unknown where she obtained all her skills in combat and Kido. She does have a high level of Spiritual Pressure.

  • Kidō (鬼道, kidō): Kido is a form of Demon Magic mainly used by Soul Reapers. She has used the Level 63 Hadō and the more advanced techniques of Reishūkaku and Kakaku Hō.
  • Fireworks Expert: Kuukaku comes from a clan famous for their firework specialties, and she is the current master of the Shiba Clan.

Weapons & Equipment

Reishūkaku

Reishūkaku (霊集核)

Kakaku Hō

Kakaku Hō (花鶴砲)

Sword

It's currently unknown if Kūkaku's katana is or isn't a Zanpakutō, a Soul Reaper sword. It's a short bladed katana with pale orange hilt and a rectangular-etched guard. Each corner of the guard is curved inward. She keeps her sword strapped to the remains of her right are. She has used this sword to ignite the launch of the Kakaku Hō.

Statistics

Characteristics

  • Birthday: 1 October
  • Hair: Black
  • Eyes: Green
  • Height: 168 cm (5'6")
  • Weight: 58 kg (128 lbs.)

Status

  • Place of Birth: unknown
  • Citizenship: Japanese
  • Occupation: Shiba Clan Leader
  • Known Relatives: Kaien Shiba (older brother - deceased), Ganju Shiba (younger brother), Miyako Shiba (sister-in-law / Kaien's wife - deceased), Isshin Kurosaki (Shiba Clan), Masaki Kurosaki (Isshin's wife - deceased), Ichigo Kurosaki (Isshin and Masaki's eldest son), Karin Kurosaki (Isshin and Masaki's twin daughter), and Yuzu Kurosaki (Isshin and Masaki's twin daughter).

Other Media

Anime

BLEACH (2004)

The BLEACH animated series is a direct adaptation of Tite Kubo's original manga. It's produced by Studio Pierrot and first began airing in October 5, 2004. Kūkaku's first anime appearance was in BLEACH - Episode 23 "14 Days Before Rukia's Execution", which aired on March 15 2005.

Her character in the Japanese series is voiced by Akiko Hiramatsu, and the U.S. dub produced by VIZ Media is done by Cindy Robinson.

Kūkaku Shiba's appearance is censored in the anime production. In the manga, she is shown with her right arm missing at all times, but for the anime a prosthetic right arm is added to the series. It's never shown to move. The particular reason for such an edit is unknown, but the series does have a practice of toning down graphically violent scenes of dismemberment.

Kūkaku plays a limited role in manga and only appears in the Soul Society arc, but she appears again in the several different filler arcs. She appearance is in the filler Bount Arc. She sends her brother to the the Earth realm to help in the battle against super powered humans called Bount, then punished him for not being of aid. Ichigo and Yoruichi return to Soul Society and come to see her when the Bount invade the Soul Society. She later appears in the filler Gotei 13 Invasion Army arc in a minor role.

Games

As a series based mainly on fighting and battles, Kūkaku Shiba has made numerous playable appearances in the BLEACH series of games. her first appearance in games was in Bleach: Dark Souls for the Nintendo DS. that was released in Japan in February 15, 2007.

(For a full list of games that feature Kūkaku Shiba, see her profile on Giant Bomb. HERE)
name: Kūkaku Shiba

deck: Samui is the stoic jonin-kunochi from the Hidden Cloud Village, and the leader of Team Samui.
description:
Origin

Samui is a jonin-class female ninja from the Kumogakure and the leader of Team Samui. She's in charge of the exuberant Karui and overly pessimistic, Omoi.

Creation

Samui (サムイ, Samui) is a supporting character of the Naruto series that was created by Masashi Kishimoto, It first began serialization in Shueisha's Weekly Shonen Jump in November 1999. She was later introduced during the Invasion of Pain story arc that began in Volume 44.

She first appeared in Naruto Volume 45, CH. 417 "Raikage On the Move!!",

Character Evolution

" You two. If you're a ninja, act cooler. "

Samui - "Naruto" Vol. 45 Ch. 417

Samui's name comes from the word 寒い (samui), which means "cold". This is apparently a reflection upon her stoic personality.

Major Story Arcs

Invasion of Pain Arc

Team Samui was summoned to the office of Ei Yotsuki, the Raikage, due to Killer Bee being abducted by Sasuke Uchiha of the Akatsuki. They were being sent to the Leaf Village to gather all information on Sasuke and to announce the summit of the Kages in the Land of Iron.

Five Kage Summit Arc

Samui's team arrived at the leaf Village just prior to the invasion of Pain, that destroyed much of the village. With Tsunade, the Fifth Hokage, in a coma, the letter was then given to Danzo Shimura, who granted their requests. As the data was being gathered for them, Samui toured the devastation of the village. She fond the people in oddly high spirits as they talked about their savior, Naruto Uzumaki.

Samui found Naruto with her team, and he seemed to have been beaten. Karui denied any involvement, but they had learned from Naruto that the Akatsuki take their victims alive. They wanted to go to Bee's rescue, but she pointed out that they had no idea of where to start looking. Later, Naruto tried asking for a meeting with the Raikage to ask for forgiveness for Sasuke, but Samui refused.

After gathering and copying the records on Sasuke, they left to rendezvous with the Raikage on his way to the Land of Iron. They had no idea that they were tracked and followed by Naruto and his team to make a plea direct plea to the Raikage. She watched as he bowed in the snow. He desperately wished to end the cycle of hatred that could just lead to more death. While admirable, the Raikage refused.

Fourth Shinobi World War Arc

As the shinobi nations untied, the Raikage placed Samui in charge of creating a squad specifically for surprise attacks, and she made her appearance to help Omoi against the revived Kinkaku and Ginkaku. Atsui aided Samui in this fight against these legendary Cloud Ninja criminals, but the brothers used their cursed tools against them. Their own words were used against then with a cruse, and Samui and her brother were then trapped inside the Benihisago. Despite Omoi turning the tables and trapping Ginkaku inside the Benihisago, as well. It was stolen by Tobi before Omoi could find a way to save them.

Powers & Abilities

Samui is a sword fighter who uses the technique called Kenjutsu, a specialty among the ninja from the Cloud Village. Any jutsu techniques she uses has not been revealed.

Weapons & Equipment

Short Sword

Her weapon is a style of Japanese short-sword called a tantō that she holds in the sheath on her back at the waist.

Other Media

Anime

Naruto Shippuden (2007)

The Naruto Shippuden anime series is the second direct adaptation of Masashi Kishimoto's original manga. This series is produced by Studio Pierrot and first began airing in February 15, 2007. Samui's first anime appearance was in Naruto Shippuden Episode 156 "Surpassing the Master", which aired on April 15, 2010. Her character in the Japanese series is voiced by Hikari Yono, and the U.S. dub produced by VIZ Media is done by Gina Bowes.

NARUTO Spin-Off: Rock Lee & His Ninja Pals (2012)

The NARUTO Spin-Off: Rock Lee & His Ninja Pals (NARUTO-ナルト- SD ロック・リーの青春フルパワー忍伝 , NARUTO Sugoi Doryoku: Rokku Rī no Seishun Furupowā Ninden) anime is a short-comedy adaptation of the of the Naruto spin-off manga series, Rock Lee's Seishun Full Power Ninden. It's produced by Studio Pierrot and first began airing in April 3. 2012. While not a direct adaptation of the spin-off manga, it follows the same theme of chibi-style characters that focuses on Team 9 in wacky adventures and situations that frequently breaks the fourth wall.

Samui's first appearance is in NARUTO Spin-Off: Rock Lee & His Ninja Pals Ep. 44 "The Staff Will Eat the Beans Afterwards! / The Raikage Is Under Attack!", which aired on February 5, 2013. Her character in the Japanese series is voiced by Hikari Yono, and the series has not been dubbed in English.

Films

Naruto 5: Blood Prison

There have been several films in the Naruto series produced by Studio Pierrot. Samui's first film appearance in the franchise is in Naruto the Movie: Blood Prison, the eighth movie that was released to Japanese theaters in July 30, 2011. The movie was directed by Masahiko Murata and screenplay by Akira Higashiyama. Samui appears briefly in the beginning of the film. Her character in the Japanese version is voiced by Hikari Yono, and the U.S. dub produced by VIZ Media is done by Gina Bowes.
name: Samui

deck: Mabui is a dark-skinned ninja from the Hidden Cloud Village and the secretary of the Fourth Raikage, Ei Yotsuki.
description:
Origin

Creation

Mabui (マブイ, Mabui) is a supporting character of the Naruto series that was created by Masashi Kishimoto, It first began serialization in Shueisha's Weekly Shonen Jump in November 1999. She was later introduced during the Invasion of Pain story arc that began in Volume 44.

She first appeared in Naruto Volume 45, CH. 416 "The Tale of the Utterly Gutsy Shinobi",

Character Evolution

Mabui (眩い) in Japanese means cute, or pretty.

Major Story Arcs

Invasion of Pain Arc

Five Kage Summit Arc

Confining the Jinchūriki Arc

Fourth Shinobi World War Arc

Ten-Tails Revival Arc

Powers & Abilities

Mabui's Jutsu

  • Ethereal Transmission Jutsu (天送の術, tensō no jutsu): The Ethereal Transmission Jutsu is a technique that is unique to Mabui. With this jutsu, she can teleport an object to any location at the speed of light. To transport, Mabui must have the exact geographic coordinates. While this is normally used to transport objects, it can also be used on living organism, such as people. The problem is that humans can't normally survive traveling at the speed of light. The third Raikage was able to be transported unharmed, due to his incredible durability. Ei Yotsuki and Tsunade were transported, but repaired their wounds upon arrival. The ability of this jutsu is one of the primary reasons she was selected as the aide to the Raikage.

Weapons & Equipment

Other Media

Anime

Naruto Shippuden (2007)

The Naruto Shippuden anime series is the second direct adaptation of Masashi Kishimoto's original manga. This series is produced by Studio Pierrot and first began airing in February 15, 2007. Samui's first anime appearance was in Naruto Shippuden Episode 152 "Somber News", which aired on March 25, 2010. Her character in the Japanese series is voiced by Misaki Sekiyama, and the U.S. dub produced by VIZ Media is performed by Dorothy Elias-Fahn.

Films

Naruto 5: Blood Prison

There have been several films in the Naruto series produced by Studio Pierrot. Mabui's first film appearance in the franchise is in Naruto the Movie: Blood Prison, the eighth movie that was released to Japanese theaters in July 30, 2011. The movie was directed by Masahiko Murata and screenplay by Akira Higashiyama. Samui appears briefly in the beginning of the film. Her character in the Japanese version is voiced by Misaki Sekiyama, and the U.S. dub produced by VIZ Media is done by Dorothy Elias-Fahn.
name: Mabui

deck: A homeless drug addict who befriended the Defenders.
description: Ira "Sunshine" Gross was killed by Ian Fate and returned as a ghost to help guide Devil-Slayer.
name: Ira Gross

aliases: William Rudolph's Ace in the Hole
deck: An alien who crash-landed on U.S. soil during World War II. He has been working with the U.S. Army in secrecy ever since as their own super-being, even more powerful than Superman.
description:
Origin

On the brink of war in 1938, US scientists sent a mathematical equation into space, but the mathematical equation was incorrect, and added up to more than the sum of it's parts, to signify the message "let us add up to more, together." Eleven seconds later, a ship crash landed on Earth, with a similar, more complex equation, with a gift enclosed, an alien who would become known as Wraith. His name standing for "William Rudolph's Ace in the Hole," the US Army would build a home for Wraith, and in return, he'd operate in secret for the Army during world crisis. His first major mission was to act as the bomb that was dropped over Nagasaki, which lead the world to believe the US had more nuclear arms than it did.

Creation

Wraith was created by Superman Unchained writer Scott Snyder and artist Jim Lee.

Major Story Arcs

Superman Unchained

Wraith meets Superman in Superman Unchained, and is initially not presented as a villain. He has been doing secret missions for the US Military for decades, in a way, being the original "Superman." He shows that he is stronger than Superman, and just as fast and durable when they fight the first time. Wraith comments that eventually he will have to kill Superman, for interfering with General Lane's plans. When nuclear missiles are released, aimed for countries all over the world, Wraith only agrees to help destroy the ones that will harm America, leaving Wonder Woman, Green Lantern, and Superman to deal with the rest. When Wraith and Superman fight for a second time, Wraith easily dominates the fight, until Superman uses the radioactive isotope that weakens Wraith, formed by Batman, to drive him away. Soon after, Wraith goes to the Batcave to deal with Batman for this, dressed in armor to protect him from the radioactive isotope. He is met not only by Batman, who is using a stealth suit that hides him from Wraith, but Wonder Woman as well. Batman and Wonder Woman use everything in the Cave, including the batmobiles, other bat-vehicles, and the giant penny, but nothing is able to keep Wraith down. After Wraith attacks the duo with the robotic T-Rex kept in the Batcave, Superman arrives to help Batman and Wonder Woman continue the battle.

Superman starts the fight aggressively, but Wraith uses his superior strength and speed to quickly take the upper hand and starts to manhandle Superman. Wraith also shows off many powers his longer time in the sun's radiation had given him. Superman realizes that he is outclassed and cannot beat Wraith with physical might. Using his brains, Superman grabs and flies Wraith into space where he couldn't breathe and tries to kill him that way, driving him all the way through the moon in the process. Wraith however uses his strength to overpower Superman, and then uses his energy powers to imitate the signature of Kryptonite to weaken Superman and bring the fight back to earth. On earth Wraith attempts to drown Superman in the ocean. With his face pressed into the bottom of the ocean, he realizes he isn't strong enough to beat Wraith, and digs down and takes the fight all the way to the core of the earth. Superman had known that the earth's magnetic field, which is strongest at the core, would interfere with Wraith's energy and electronic abilities, weakening him enough for Superman, with the help of the ring Batman gave him that weakens Wraith, to punch him out and leave him in the lava core of the earth.

Powers & Abilities

  • Alien Physiology: Wraith has a physiology that is similar to, but much stronger than that of Superman. Wraith notes that this amount of control over his energy signature has taken decades. His body is solar powered, but processes solar energy much more efficiently than Superman's body does.
  • Invisibility: Wraith was able to use his powers of invisibility to follow Superman around and learn his secret identity.
  • Energy Absorption: Wraith is capable of absorbing and manipulating the absorption of electromagnetic energy, especially solar power. His absorption, when controlled, averages at one hundred and sixty gigawatts of solar energy.
  • Energy Projection: Wraith is capable of releasing powerful blasts of energy that are capable of destroying large metal structures, causing them to detonate.
  • Energy Transference: Wraith is capable of manipulating his energy signature to such a degree that he can transform his body in minor ways such as developing spikes that can emit the same signature as Kryptonite.
  • Flight: Wraith can fly as fast as Superman can.
  • Sound Manipulation: Capable of tightening his throat muscles to create an echo chamber in order to release a sonic attack from his mouth.
  • Superhuman Durability: Wraith is far more durable than Superman, due to his being exposed to sunlight longer and using it more efficiently.
  • Superman Speed: Wraith is capable of easily catching a punch from Superman, and in their third encounter Superman admitted that Wraith was faster.
  • Superhuman Strength: Possesses a strength greater than that of Superman, able to kick him halfway across the continental United States, and manhandle him easily in a fight.

Weakness

Wraith was shown to be susceptible to a select radioactive isotope that reacts with his specific energy signature that weakens him to the point where he is no longer able to fight Superman.
name: Wraith
real_name: William Rudolph's Ace in the Hole

deck: Bipolar artist and superhero.
description:
Origin

Bipolar artist in New York. Tim didn't know of his disease until he went off the deep end and thought he was an invincible superhero messiah who worked in the nude. This mirage was quickly dashed to bits when he was run over by a Jetta and hospitalized.

Creation

Written by Max Bemis and drawn by Jorge Coelho.

Major Story Arcs

After his Jetta incident, Tim is kept sedated while being studied (though he is led to believe he was in a coma). Upon release from the hospital, Tim begins seeing Dr. Mays while attempting to recreate the vigor with which he used to paint. He also begins seeing Alexis, a girl he can't stand that takes him to trendy events he hates. He realizes that his life is a farce upon having a conversation with Lily, an old love interest, and he decides it's high time to go crazy and take his life back.

Tim goes crazy and loves it. He notices, however, that he seems to be able to read thoughts. One particularly discomforting thought comes from a building that seems to have someone spying on him. Despite the protestations of his best friend Adam, Tim investigates and finds a man who pulls a gun on him. This is Agent Spencer and Tim immediately head-butts Spencer's head into a million pieces. Tim gets scared that his delusions are getting far to real.
name: Tim

deck: Katsuyu is the giant Slug Queen summoned by the Fifth Hokage, Tsunade.
name: Katsuyu

volume_credits.name: Rock Lee's Seishun Full Power Ninden

deck: Forever is the Lazarus of the Carlyle family. The member that received all the best training, technology and enhancements.
description:
Origin

Forever is a Lazarus, A Lazarus is a genetically modified human who has been raised since birth to serve under a major family, following any order given by the head of the family without any remorse even to the extent of executing people they know are innocent.

Forever was created for the Carlyle family, However it is revealed that she actually isn't Carlyle's real daughter, and her siblings refer to her as "replaceable". She was trained since birth by numerous teachers, however she obviously doesn't go through a normal type of school. Forever was learning how to kill efficiently.

Each Lazarus is different, Forever is genetically modified to be a "Super Soldier", while another one may of been modified with major cybernetics.

Current Affairs

After an attack on a Carlyle holding. Malcolm the head of the Carlyle family decides to go to war with the Morray family the perpetrators of the attack. Forever is sent to deal with them but is captured in the process.

Powers and Abilities

Forever has been genetically enhanced and the full extent of what she can do has yet to be revealed this is what we have seen thus far:

Healing factor: Forever has a very good healing factor, allowing her to heal from bullet wounds very easily despite them all puncturing her organs repeatedly, and has even survived being shot by an Apache missile while inside a car that blew up.

Unarmed and armed Combat: Forever is a very gifted combatant ranging from unarmed, melee and gun combat. Her signature style is with her sword.

Stealth: Forever is gifted at stealth being able to sneak into enemy compounds unnoticed.

Super Strength: Forever has a degree of enhanced strength, despite having been shot 6+ times throughout her organs repeatedly, she was able to overpower grown men bigger then her, something that would be hard for a normal female at full strength.

X-Ray Vision: Forever possesses X-Ray vision allowing her to see threw walls, this allowed her to see someone was stealing from her family.
name: Forever Carlyle

issue_credits.name: In our last chapter Don-Vin "the Hyper" was left...
In our last chapter Don-Vin "the Hyper" was left...

first_appeared_in_issue.name: In our last chapter Don-Vin "the Hyper" was left...

issue_credits.name: In our last chapter Don-Vin "the Hyper" was left...

deck: Kurotsuchi is a ninja from the Hidden Stone Village and the grand daughter of Onoki, the Tsuchikage. After the Fourth Shinobi War, she took over as Tsuchikage from her grandfather.
description:
Origin

Creation

Kurotsuchi (黒ツチ, Kurotsuchi) is a supporting character of the Naruto series that was created by Masashi Kishimoto, It first began serialization in Shueisha's Weekly Shonen Jump in November 1999. She was later introduced during the Five Kage Summit Arc that began in Volume 48.

She first appeared in Naruto Volume 49, CH. 454 "Enter the Five Kage…!!".

Character Evolution

Masashi Kishimoto has confirmed in interviews that Kurotsuchi's design was intentionally based on a dancer to give a feeling of lightness and agility. Many readers were unsure of her gender until this was confirmed by Kishimoto and the second Naruto Fanbook.

In Japanese, Kurotsuchi's name (黒土, kurotsuchi) means "Black Earth".

Major Story Arcs

Five Kage Summit Arc

With a summit of the five Kages was called by the Raikage, Kurotsuchi went with Akatsuchi as Onoki's bodyguard to the Land of Iron. The summit was to talk about the rise of the Akatsuki and forming an united front. The tense meeting became a battle as Sasuke Uchiha attacked. Kurotsuchi wanted to see Sasuke, since he was the one who killed Deidara. Onoki nearly managed to kill Sasuke when he arrived to the meeting hall, but he was saved by Madara Uchiha, who went on to declare war on the five nations to claim the two remaining Jinchūriki.

Confining the Jinchūriki Arc

With the location of the hiding place of the Jinchūriki being revealed, Onoki went as backup with Kurotsuchi and Akatsuchi. On the flight to the Giant Island Turtle, they ran into Deidara, who had been revived form the dead by Kabuto Yakushi. Kurotsuchi fight with Kabuto on the Island Turtle, and she managed to trick Kabuto into falling in her trap using her Quicklime Jutsu. She surrounded him in her cement for good measure for Aoba to interrogate, but he escaped by transforming into a snake. Kabuto then captured Yamato before transporting away inside his Manda II snake.

Fourth Shinobi World War Arc

In the Shinobi Alliance, Kurotsuchi was placed in the Second Division, under the command of her father, Kitsuchi. During the first battle for her division, Kurotsuchi and Kitsuchi used the Erupt Jutsu to unearth the arm of White Zetsu used by the Akatsuki as foot soldiers. They would eventually fall back from this battle to support the First Division.

Ten-Tails Revival Arc

With Obito Uchiha and the real Madara Uchiha attempting to revive the Ten-Tailed Beast, Kurotsuchi did her part with the other Stone Ninja to trap the monster with the Quicklime technique.

Powers & Abilities

Kurotsuchi is a ninja with advanced abilities that include the rare talent of combining different natures of chakra to create a new form. Her talent as a ninja is high enough that she is one of the bodyguards of the Tsuchikage.

Taijutsu

Taijutsu (体術, taijutsu) is one of the more basic forms of hand-to-hand combat taught to all ninja from the various nations. It typically requires no use of chakra or hand signs. Though Kurotsuchi is undoubtedly skilled and trained in these techniques, she has never displayed the use of any advanced forms in combat.

Ninjutsu

Kurotsuchi has shown the ability to use Earth Style, Fire Style, Water Style, and Lava Style based ninjutsu. Among her abilities is the use of the Kekkei Genkai (血継限界, kekkei genkai) known as Nature Transforamtion. This is a rare inherited trait that is passed down through various ninja clans. This is normally preformed by combining different natures of chakra to create a new form. Kurotsuchi's kekkei genkai is used by combining Earth and Fire Styles to then create Lava Style justu. Very few ninja have this level of talent and control to use or master these techniques.

  • Earth Style: Earth Done Jutsu: The Earth Done technique is basic level Earth Style jutsu. Using it created a dome of varying size to shield the user. Kurotsuchi has use this technique to shield herself from tons of falling rock.
  • Earth Style: Erupt (土遁・開土昇掘, Doton: Kaido Shōkutsu): By pressing the hands on the ground, the user of this technique can forcibly eject a large number of enemies that have hidden themselves undergroud out of what appears as a large volcano. Kurotsuchi has used this this technique to reveal a large number of White Zetsu that mostly travel underground.
  • Lava Style: Quicklime Jutsu (熔遁・石灰凝の術, Yōton: Sekkaigyō no Jutsu): Using her kekkei genkai, Kurotsuchi creates a corrosive quicklime sludge she fires from her mouth. Even if she misses her initial strike, she can combine the attack with water to capture a target as it turns the quicklime into a substance harder than cement.

  • Water Style: Trumpet (水遁・水喇叭, Suiton: Mizurappa): Kurotsuchi uses this technique by firing a huge torrent of water from her mouth and compressed through her hands to increase the focus and pressure. She uses this in combination with her Quicklime Jutsu to transform it into cement.

Weapons & Equipment

Statistics

Affiliation: Hidden Stone Village

Rank: Unknown

Registered Ninja #: Unknown

Date Of Birth: Unknown

Age: 17

Zodiac Sign: Unknown

Weight: ??kg

Other Media

Anime

Naruto Shippuden (2007)

The Naruto Shippuden anime series is the second direct adaptation of Masashi Kishimoto's original manga. This series is produced by Studio Pierrot and first began airing in February 15, 2007. Samui's first anime appearance was in Naruto Shippuden Episode 199 "Enter the Five Kage!", which aired on February 17, 2011. Her character in the Japanese series is voiced by Hana Takeda, and the U.S. dub produced by VIZ Media is performed by Laura Bailey.

deck: Art hipster.
description:
Origin

Probably the result of a modest upbringing and a desire to differentiate himself from the masses through holier-than-thou personification while still trying to fit in somewhere.

Creation

Written by Max Bemis and drawn by Jorge Coelho.

Major Story Arcs

Attends Tim's art show. He seems to be a favorite of Tim's girlfriend Alexis, as she seems to want to hear his opinion on various art pieces.

deck: Undercover agent working for Dr. Mays.
description:
Origin

Hired by Dr. Mays to monitor Tim.

Creation

Written by Max Bemis and drawn by Jorge Coelho.

Major Story Arcs

Agent Spencer takes a break from watching Tim and dives into a delicious reuben sandwich. This proves fatal, however, since Tim can read thoughts. Tim tracks Agent Spencer's thoughts and gets the jump on him. Tim head butts Agent Spencer's head into a million pieces.

description:
Origin

Tim's best friend since the two were kids.

Creation

Written by Max Bemis and drawn by Jorge Coelho.

deck: Hipster socialite and skank.
description:
Origin

Alexis is a hipster girl that becomes attracted to Tim once his art gets popular.

Creation

Written by Max Bemis and drawn by Jorge Coelho.

Major Story Arcs

Alexis dates Tim for a while because she recalls that he was adventurous and risky before his mental breakdown. Once he's on medication, however, she gets bored with him - though stays dating him. She attends art shows with her hip friends that all seem to be guys.

After one art show, Alexis admits to Tim that she thinks the relationship may not be working. He leaves before she can actually break anything off.

The two stay together and Tim accompanies her to a dinner party. She gives him some cocaine and he wigs out, using a superpower he recently discovered to begin seeing into guest's minds. He correctly accuses Alexis of sleeping with Rob the night prior and leaves the party. She doesn't see him again.
name: Alexis

description:
First appearance 1940 in Weird Comics #1 (April 1940) and disappeared after Weird Comics #5. (August 1940).

Believing that the world needed a defender, Thor bestowed powers, similar to his own, onto Grant Farrel. Powers Farrel used to fight crime.

Thor's appearance changed over his five issue run, from blue helmet, blue trunks and cape to a gold helmet and red trunks and eventually no cape and helmet just Farrel with his original hair.

Arkham War

Talon: The Fall of the Owls

deck: An orphaned child adopted by Jubilee and briefly possessed by Arkea.
description:
Origin

When the sentient bacteria Arkea traveled to Earth seeking revenge on her brother Sublime, she used a series of asteroids and meteors as her method of transportation. One of these meteors landed in Budapest, causing widespread destruction. The X-Man Jubilee, in Hungary at the time, adopted a baby orphaned by the meteor strike, who she named Shogo.

Creation

Shogo was created by writer Brian Wood and artist Olivier Coipel. He made his debut in the first issue of Wood's X-Men series,(Adjectiveless) X-Men Volume 3 issue 1 and was first identified by name in the second issue.

Major Story Arcs

Primer

Unbeknownst to Jubilee, Shogo was being used as a host by Arkea. Arkea used her power to possess machinery to stop a train they were traveling on and kill the drivers, although the intervention of the X-Men prevented any further loss of life. Arkea left Shogo's body after Jubilee arrived at the Jean Grey School, opting instead use the body of Karima Shapandar as a way to take over the school's computer system.

Sublime, who had followed Jubilee and Shogo to the school to warn the X-Men about his sister, explained that Shogo had essentially been "reset" upon Arkea leaving him - and also offered the opinion that Shogo was Jubilee's son. While the X-Men and Sublime tracked down and dealt with the Arkea threat in a specialized hospital in Budapest, Shogo and Jubilee stayed behind in a van. As Jubilee gave Storm and the team intel on the hospital's layout, she multitasked by searching records to see if Shogo had any living relatives. By the time the X-Men and a now recovered Karima returned to the van, Jubilee explained with confidence that Shogo Lee was 100% hers.

Battle of the Atom

During Battle of the Atom it was shown that one of the future X-Men that were introduced, Sentinel X, is actually Shogo who appears in an Iron Man Armor style battle-suit. When that future version of Jubilee was killed, Sentinel X consoled the much younger present-day-version of Jubilee and let her know that she will continue to be a wonderful mother and raise him well. This gave her the assurance that she did the right thing by adopting him.

Further Adventures

Baby Shogo continued to accompany his mother, Jubilee, while she remained an active member of the X-Men. When Jubilee took a break from the team, Shogo accompanied her as she became Patsy Walker's assistant. Patsy and all of her friends immediately fell in love with Shogo and his cute antics, with some of her friends offering to babysit when his mom had to go to work. Shogo will return to the X-Mansion yet again when his mom becomes the leader and teacher of Generation X.

deck: Animal Path (female) is the second of the Animal Paths in the Six Paths of Pain. She was a ninja from the Hidden Rain Village and specializes in summoning jutsu.
description:
Origin

Animal Path (female) is a young female ninja of unknown origin. After she was killed, her body was preserved and stored to serve as one of the replacements bodies for the Six Paths of Pain at the Hidden Rain Village. Once the original Animal Path was killed by Jiraiya, she was taken from storage to activate in his place. Nagato had the Rinnegan eyes implanted into her body along with chakra receiver, so he could remotely control her body and see through her eyes.

Creation

Animal Path (female) (畜生道 (女), Chikushōdō (onna)) is an antagonist of the Naruto series that was created by Masashi Kishimoto. It first began serialization Shueisha's Weekly Shonen Jump in November 1999. She would not appear until the Invasion of Pain Arc that begins in Volume 44.

She first appeared in Naruto Volume 44, CH. 407 "Addressed to Naruto".

Character Evolution

Major Story Arcs

Invasion of Pain Arc

Powers & Abilities

Summoning Jutsu

Rinnegan

Other Media

Anime

Naruto Shippuden (2007)

The Naruto Shippuden anime series is the second direct adaptation of Masashi Kishimoto's original manga. This series It's produced by Studio Pierrot and first began airing in February 15, 2007. Her first anime appearance was in Naruto Shippuden - Episode 155 "The First Challenge", which aired on April 8, 2010. Her character in the Japanese series is voiced by Shiho Hisajima, and the U.S. dub produced by VIZ Media has yet to be announced.

She's the only member of the Six Paths of Pain to have her own separate voice actress in the anime adaptation.

Games

The Animal Path (female) makes her first game appearance in Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 2. She shares the same Japanese voice actress as her anime adaptation, and the English voice is performed by Kari Wahlgren. In the following game, Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja Impact, her English voice is performed by Stephanie Sheh.
name: Animal Path (female)
